intro: Linaria pelisseriana, commonly known as the Pelisser's toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features bright yellow flowers with distinctive spurred petals, which are characteristic of the Scrophulariaceae family. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rugged appearance. Linaria pelisseriana thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
